fields.name: Biography
fields.description: Narrative of a Person's Life - A true story about a real person. When written from their own perspective it is called an autobiography.

fields.name: Drama
fields.description: Stories composed in verse or prose, usually for theatrical performance, where conflicts and emotion are expressed through dialogue and action.

fields.name: Essay
fields.description: A short literary composition that reflects the author's outlook or point.

fields.name: Fable
fields.description: Narration demonstrating a useful truth, especially in which animals speak as humans; legendary, supernatural tale.

fields.name: Fairytale
fields.description: A story about fairies or other magical creatures, usually for children.

fields.name: Fantasy
fields.description: Fiction with strange or other worldly settings or characters; fiction which invites suspension of reality.

fields.name: Fiction Narrative
fields.description: Literary works whose content is produced by the imagination and is not necessarily based on fact.

fields.name: Fiction in verse
fields.description: Full-length novels with plot, subplot(s), theme(s), major and minor characters, in which the narrative is presented in (usually blank) verse form.

fields.name: Folklore
fields.description: The songs, stories, myths, and proverbs of a people or "folk" as handed down by word of mouth.

fields.name: Historical fiction
fields.description: A story with fictional characters and events in a historical setting.

fields.name: Horror
fields.description: Fiction in which events evoke a feeling of dread in both the characters and the reader.

fields.name: Humour
fields.description: Fiction full of fun, fancy, and excitement, meant to entertain; but can be contained in all genres

fields.name: Legend
fields.description: A story, sometimes of a national or folk hero, that has a basis in fact but also includes imaginative material.

fields.name: Mystery
fields.description: Fiction dealing with the solution of a crime or the unraveling of secrets.

fields.name: Mythology
fields.description: A legend or traditional narrative, often based in part on historical events, that reveals human behavior and natural phenomena by its symbolism; often pertaining to the actions of the gods.

fields.name: Narrative nonfiction
fields.description: Factual information presented in a format which tells a story.

fields.name: Poetry
fields.description: Verse and rhythmic writing with imagery that creates emotional responses.

fields.name: Realistic fiction
fields.description: A story that can actually happen and is true to life.

fields.name: Science fiction
fields.description: A story based on impact of actual, imagined, or potential science, usually set in the future or on other planets. Happens to be better than all other genres.

fields.name: Short story
fields.description: Fiction of such brevity that it supports no subplots.

fields.name: Speech
fields.description: Public address or discourse

fields.name: Tall tale
fields.description: A humorous story with blatant exaggerations, swaggering heroes who do the impossible with nonchalance.
